addChangeInfo(ChangeInfo) - Method in class org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator.XMLManipulatorPlugin
This method is called by the subprocessors in order to define the changes of an XML-Document.
The changes were added sequencially so the order of addition matters, to the XMLManipulator.
If you add an node then change or delete it meight work, if you remove it before you add it it will cause exceptions
addColumn(String, String) - Method in class org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator.XMLDatabaseTable
 
AddPlugin - Class in org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator
This Class provides the functionality to add nodes to a given XML-Document by defining an XPath.
If your Path is not found, the XMLManipulator tries to reconstruct it by backtracking.
AddPlugin() - Constructor for class org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator.AddPlugin
 
addXPathNode(String, String) - Method in class org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator.XMLManipulator
This function adds a new Node to an valid xpath, to keep the well-form of a document, this function works this way:
- Begin with the first node defined in the XPath
- if it just an attribute add a new node named "node" containing this attribute with an empty value if "value" is empty
to the document root node
- if the document has none this node becomes the root node
- if it is an node check if any node in this document matches this node with all his attributes (first appearence only)
- Matches if a node has all the same attributes and values
- if there is one append the rest of the nodes described by the xpath expression (this will add the attributes contained in predicates too)
- if there is no matching node append the path to the document root node
- if it's an empty document, create this root node using the first node discribed by the xpath
append(XMLDatabaseTable) - Method in class org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator.XMLDatabaseTable
Appends a new Document to this one,
attributeCount() - Method in class org.kkevin.xmlmanipulator.XPathNode
Return how many attributes exist
